it.uniroma2.sel.simlab.jeqn.policies

Interface ImplicitInputPolicy<I>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    InputPolicy, Policy
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ImplicitAndExplicitPolicy<I,E,D>, ImplicitButNotExplicitPolicy<I,D>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CategoryBasedMapDispatchingPolicy, CategoryBasedRoutingPolicy, CombinedPolicy, ConditionBasedPolicy, ConstantForkingPolicy, ConstantSplittingPolicy, FIFOEnqueuingPolicy, FiniteSourceTerminationPolicy, ImplicitAndExplicitInputAndStateDependentPolicy, ImplicitAndExplicitInputDependentPolicy, ImplicitButNotEsplicitMaskingStateOnlyDependentPolicy, ImplicitButNotExplicitInputAndStateDependentPolicy, ImplicitButNotExplicitInputOnlyDependentPolicy, IntegerMappingPolicy, InterleavedPolicy, LIFOEnqueuingPolicy, LongestQueueSelectionPolicy, MapImplicitAndExplicitInputDependentPolicy, MaskBasePolicy, MaskExplicitPolicy, MaskImplicitAndExplicitInputDependentPolicy, MaskImplicitButNotExplicitInputAndStateDependentPolicy, MaskImplicitButNotExplicitInputDependentPolicy, MaskImplicitPolicy, MaskStateDependentPolicy, MaskStateOnlyDependentPolicy, NumericSequenceBasedRoutingPolicy, ShortestQueueDispatchingPolicy, ShortestQueueSelectionPolicy, ShortRequestTimeFirstEnqueuingPolicy, TillNotEmptySelectionPolicy, TimeBasedTerminationPolicy, UserBasedPolicy, UserPriorityPreemptionPolicy

    public interface ImplicitInputPolicy<I>
extends InputPolicy
    Identifies a policy that depends only on implicit input, i.e. the input data that is set into the policy object, at object instantiation time and at anytime during the program execution, except at decision invocation time.
    Author:
    Daniele Gianni
